result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Claude Berry

defendant.name: Berry, Andrew Claude

records.addlTxt:
11:39 AM Cases 22CM33 and 22CM95 called together.  Defendant Andrew Claude Berry in court.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Andrew Claude Berry.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Otten: def pleading to Ct 1 of 22CM95; DRI 22CM33, joint rec 1 yr probation, withheld sentence, anger management, and court costs.  Discussion of no-contact condition; already a R.O. in place.  State assures VR compliance.  Atty Otten files PLQ.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 of 22CM95: violate harassment restraining order and orders a JOC; remaining case DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def declines to make a statement to the Court.  
Court orders:
1 year probation, withheld sentence
Conditions:
Assesses $443 court costs, anger management, comply with injunction that is in place, follow all DOC programming recs.  Court costs to be paid w/current payment plan with Clerk of Courts office. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Report to probation immediately.  If def completes all conditions, def can discharge early at agent's discretion.  
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building; and fingerprints if needed.

9:45 AM Cases 22CM33 and 22CM95 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew Claude Berry appeared by video.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Andrew Claude Berry. Def waives all in-person hearing KIV.  Atty Otten makes record regarding his video appearance, prefers to be in person.  Court to reset.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:35 AM Cases 22CM33 and 22CM95 called together. Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew Claude Berry in court.  Cases on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: agreement has been reached. 
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case 22CM95 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered.  Atty Otten updates on 22CM33.  Def confirms mailing address.
Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Prior to leaving the courthouse, the defendant shall report to the sheriff's dept. to provide fingerprints.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on May 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:12 AM Defendant, Andrew Claude Berry, appeared with Attorney Alysja Otten.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Andrew Claude Berry appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court addresses video appearance; def makes explanation.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: missing parts of discovery, needs more time to obtain and review that.  Def is ordered to appear in person for next hearing.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
